content: The Act titled "Securing America's Energy Independence Act of 2007" extends and modifies the investment tax credit for solar energy and qualified fuel cell property. The Act "Securing America's Energy Independence Act of 2007" extends and modifies the investment tax credit for solar energy and qualified fuel cell property. Amendments include updating the years for solar energy and fuel cell property eligibility, and expanding the definition of energy property to include excess energy storage devices and solar hybrid lighting systems. The Act "Securing America's Energy Independence Act of 2007" extends and modifies the investment tax credit for solar energy and qualified fuel cell property. It includes updates for solar energy and fuel cell property eligibility, and expands the definition of energy property to include excess energy storage devices and solar hybrid lighting systems. Additionally, there are amendments regarding solar lighting equipment and a special rule for the energy credit for solar photovoltaic energy property. The energy credit for solar photovoltaic energy property is $1,500 for each half kilowatt of capacity placed in service during the taxable year. Special rules apply to rehabilitated or subsidized property. Amendments are made to the Code for property eligibility and application of the credit against the Alternative Minimum Tax. The text chunk discusses amendments to the Internal Revenue Code related to specified credits and the investment credit. The effective dates for these amendments are specified as January 1, 2007, with certain provisions applying to property placed in service after December 31, 2006. Extension and modification of credit for residential energy efficient property under SEC. 3. Extension and modification of the residential energy efficient property credit under SEC. 3 includes amending the termination date to 2016, adjusting the credit percentage for solar electric property, and setting maximum credit limits for different types of qualified property expenditures. The text chunk discusses amendments to the definition of qualified solar water heating property expenditure, qualified photovoltaic property expenditure, and the allowance of the credit against alternative minimum tax under the residential energy efficient property credit extension. The text chunk introduces a new paragraph regarding the credit allowed against alternative minimum tax for the residential energy efficient property credit extension. It includes limitations on the credit and provisions for carrying forward unused credit to the succeeding taxable year. Conforming amendments are also made to related sections of the tax code. The amendments made by this section apply to expenditures in taxable years starting after December 31, 2006, including provisions for carrying forward unused credit to the succeeding taxable year. Amendments to the Internal Revenue Code specify that the effective date for the changes applies to property placed in service after December 31, 2006.
